intro: Gonatia gratioloides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed gonatia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to southeastern Australia, where it typically grows in dry, sandy soils. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense clusters. It is often found in open woodlands and heathlands, thriving in full sun. Gonatia gratioloides is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
